At {{w|PAX_(event)|PAX Prime 2011}}, [[Mojang]] showcased an early build of '''[[Beta 1.8]]''' for public viewing. It was compiled on August 25, 2011<ref>{{tweet|notch|106630233364496384|Files have been copied to a USB stick. We will be installing 1.8 onto a bunch of computers here at PAX tomorrow. :D Now I sleep! <3|August 25, 2011}}</ref> and showcased during the event which started the next day.

== Differences from Beta 1.8 Pre-release ==
=== Blocks ===
[[File:Dead Bush JE1 BE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Dead Bush]]'''
* Missing a tooltip.

[[File:Vines (N) JE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Vines]]'''
* Missing a tooltip.

[[File:Chest (S) JE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Chest]]'''
* Uses a full block model.

[[File:Oak Fence Gate JE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Fence Gate]]'''
* Missing a tooltip.
* In the inventory it appears as a flat texture: [[File:Oak Planks (texture) JE3 BE1.png|32px|class=pixel-image]].

[[File:Cactus JE2 BE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Cactus]]'''
* Receiving damage from cacti replenishes the hunger bar.<ref>{{twitter|notch|108939701666320384|Strangely, running into a cactus refreshes the food bar. I assume @jeb_ added some debug code.|August 31, 2011}}</ref>

=== Mobs ===
'''General'''
* Every mob drops ten individual [[experience orb]]s on death.
* Passive mobs do not run around upon being attacked.

'''[[Pig]]s'''
* Old models with flat snouts are used: [[File:Pig JE1.png|width=32x32]].[[File:Saddled Pig JE1.png|width=32x32]].

[[File:Enderman JE1.png|width=50x50]]''' [[Enderman|Endermen]]'''
* Drop 0-2 [[File:Diamond JE1 BE1.png|width=32x32]] [[diamond]]s on death.

=== World generation ===
[[File:Rose JE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Rose]]'''
* Generates in the world.

'''{{EnvLink|Village|text=Villages}}'''
* Can generate in any biome, even in {{BiomeLink|ocean|text=oceans}}.

'''{{BiomeLink|Desert|text=Deserts}}'''
* Sand generates as a single layer on top of dirt.

'''{{BiomeLink|Swamp|text=Swamps}}'''
* A placeholder biome takes the place of swamps.
* Shares the same flat height values as swamps.
* Uses the same colors as {{BiomeLink|plains}}.
* Trees and short grass do not generate.

'''{{BiomeLink|Taiga|text=Taigas}}'''
* A placeholder biome takes the place of taigas.
* Uses the same colors as {{BiomeLink|plains}}.
* Sparse oak trees generate.
* Short grass does not generate.

'''{{BiomeLink|Windswept Hills|text=Extreme Hills}}'''
* Short grass does not generate.

'''{{BiomeLink|Ocean}}'''
* Short grass does not generate.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Inventory]]'''
{{Hotbar
|Diamond Pickaxe, 1
|Diamond Axe, 1
|Torch, 64
|Cooked Porkchop, 4
|Bow, 1
|Arrow, 64
}}
* The player spawns with various tools and items when creating a world in [[Survival mode]].

'''[[World spawn|Spawn]]'''
* The player spawns in a [[village]].

'''[[Sprinting]]'''
* Only lasts five seconds at a time with movement speed and field of view decreasing during this time period.

'''[[Heads-up display]]'''
* On top of the [[experience]] bar, if the player has attained at least one level, the player's "skill points" are displayed. These are simply three times the amount of levels that the player has.
* The version label in the top left corner of the screen is not included.

'''[[Controls]]'''
* Key binds cannot be bound to mouse buttons.<ref>{{twitter|notch|109263476203077633|I spent most of today tweaking stuff for 1.8. You can bind any action to a mouse button now, or to a keyboard key. Really helps trackpads.|September 1, 2011}}</ref>
* Pressing {{key|F}} does not require holding down {{key|F3}} to adjust fog distance.<ref>{{twitter|notch|109665293047046145|I am very sorry, but I took away the fog-toggle key. Next up, I'm removing jumping and cubes.|September 2, 2011}}</ref>

=== General ===
'''[[Title screen]]'''
* The old [[Mojang]] logo is used.

'''[[Multiplayer]]'''
* The multiplayer join screen does not have a refresh button.

'''[[Lighting]]'''
* Uses old update code.<ref>{{tweet|notch|110498059770802176|Committing new light update code. It's quite a bit more stable, so far.|September 5, 2011}}</ref></onlyinclude>

== Trivia ==
* The PAX Prime 2011 build of Beta 1.8 is the only version of ''[[Java Edition]]'' to be playable exclusively at a live event.
** The only other version from ''Minecraft'' as a whole like this is the [[Pocket Edition Demo]].
